definitions.title: vb.
definitions.body: twist, pervert, overturn (Targum [[סְלַף]] twist (rare); Ar. salafa is pass, pass away, come to naught Lane:1407 f.);—
pervert, Ex 23:8 (E) a bribe perverteth the case (cause, [[דִּבְרֵי]]) of righteous, = De 16:19.

subvert, turn upside down, ruin (only WisdLt): c. acc. pers. Job 12:19, Pr 13:6 (opp. [[תִּצּׂר]]), Pr 21:12; ´[[אִוֶּלֶת אָדָם תּ]] [[דַּרְכּוֹ]] Pr 19:3 a man's folly subverteth his way; [[וַיְסַלֵּף דִּבְרֵי בׂגֵד]] Pr 22:12 and he (´[[י]]) subverteth the affairs of a treacherous man.
